key_challenges.challenge: Lack of CS depth despite CS major intent
key_challenges.quote: none of them are really CS oriented except robotics...I'm not really doing anything that really showcases my CS
I'd like to expand the impact of your curriculum because you're doing a lot of things on the State level

key_challenges.description: Activities span music, CS, environmental policy, service - but no unifying narrative

key_challenges.challenge: Competitive school context makes standing out difficult
key_challenges.description: Lynbrook High School - large public with 60+ clubs, hard to differentiate

narrative_development.final_narrative: Woman in STEM (CS focus) who balances technical aptitude with artistic expression (State-level choir) and civic engagement (environmental policy advocacy)
narrative_development.differentiation_angle: Jack-of-all-trades well-rounded skill set rare for grade level + Woman in STEM positioning

frameworks_introduced.introduced_when: After EC discovery, when student expressed disconnection
frameworks_introduced.introduction_language: I think about extracurriculars, and how they support a person's profile is I think about it like a web
Usually, if it's a free program, free means it's more prestigious
You should load up on as many APs as possible, because you don't actually have to follow through and take the exam
They really start at the beginning from your standardized test and your grades, and that's your foundation
frameworks_introduced.purpose: Justify assessment sequence and set priorities

frameworks_introduced.introduction_language: Aim for positions that give you a big leadership position, but are low time commitment...to make a good impression on your teachers

frameworks_introduced.framework_name: Woman in STEM as Strategic Positioning
frameworks_introduced.introduction_language: Leverage your profile as a woman in stem...presenting yourself as a woman in stem is a very powerful positioning

add: CS research (CS + music OR CS + environmental advocacy integration)
Hackathon participation and organization (via Hack Club)
School-based CS club with leadership (Girls Who Code or general)

top_priorities: Kode With Klossy (free, women in tech, Apple connections)

course_rigor.senior_year_strategy: Load up on APs (target 12 total) but don't take all exams
course_rigor.do_not: Don't retake AP Psych (scores optional to report)

differentiation.music_supplement: Prepare 10-min recording, music resume, music letter of rec
differentiation.jack_of_all_trades_positioning: Frame as rare well-rounded skill set

rapport_building: Personal story sharing (Jenny's Stanford experience, sister in Hack Club)
Transparency framing ('No BS, no filter advice')
Partnership language ('If we start working together')
probing_techniques: 'Can you tell me more about that?' (repeated 5+ times)
'What do you want to work on before I present my opinion?' (gets self-assessment first)
Hypothetical exploration ('Have you ever thought about...')
Specific detail questions showing research ('That's team 846, right?')
reframing_tactics: Scattered activities → Unique 'web' of interconnected interests
Late-start CS → Perfect timing in 'most critical year'
Dropping robotics → Smart decision validated, pivot to leadership
Generic student → 'Jack of all trades' rare skill set
Large public school → Opportunity for strategic teacher visibility
motivation_techniques: Creating urgency without overwhelming ('Most critical year' + 'This is totally doable')
Inspiring confidence through validation ('That's very impressive')
Insider knowledge positioning ('This is hard to know by yourself, no one tells you')
Explicit reassurance ('All of this will be provided to you later')
parent_management: Direct address when parent asks questions
Maintains focus on student as primary conversation partner
Validates parent concerns but redirects to student

tier_1_critical: Ask teachers for letters of recommendation

meta_coaching_moments.explaining_assessment_structure: The reason why I'm asking you all these questions is because since this is a 360 assess session, I'm really trying to understand you holistically
meta_coaching_moments.candid_industry_critique: I'm gonna give you all of this that I've been saying to you is very no BS, because I think it's important to talk candidly
meta_coaching_moments.explaining_framework_value: Obviously, this is information that it's really hard to know by yourself, because like no one tells you
meta_coaching_moments.setting_expectations: And obviously I'm gonna write all this down and send it to you in the report. So no worries about taking notes
meta_coaching_moments.connecting_to_broader_strategy: And that kind of brings me into the next question, which is, how is your relationship with your teachers right now?

proprietary_frameworks: Senior Year AP Load-Up without taking exams
Leadership for Teacher Relationships (large school strategy)
Woman in STEM as explicit strategic positioning
candid_program_assessments: Inspirit AI critique: 'a little bit scammy'
Kode With Klossy endorsement with insider knowledge (Jenny was IA)

discovery_questions: What are some of your passions? What do you hope to do, and what are your goals?
How would you say that your classes and academics are going?
I'd love to learn more about some of the things that you're involved in
Can you tell me a little bit more about that?
What are some of the things you want to work on before I present my opinion?
narrative_questions: Does that make sense to you? [after presenting 3 hubs framework]
It seems like you're very interested in [X]...can you tell me more?
Have you ever thought about [specific action]?
Is this something that you'd like to explore further?
strategy_questions: Are you thinking about taking standardized testing anytime?
What do you think you struggle with the most on the SAT?
Have you ever been involved in research?
execution_questions: How is your relationship with your teachers right now?
By the end of high school, how many APs do forecast taking?
Do you want to stay on the West Coast, or go to the East Coast?
How big of a school do you want?

for_well_rounded_late_starters.lead_with: Web framework for connecting scattered activities
for_well_rounded_late_starters.emphasize: Urgency (critical year) + Depth over breadth + National recognition priority
for_well_rounded_late_starters.avoid: Adding more activities, generic advice about 'finding your spike'

course_rigor.ap_total: At least 12 AP classes by graduation

summer.target: Secure admission in at least 1 prestigious summer program

extracurriculars.national_level: At least 2 activities at national level
